Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> I don't have the wallet on my Mac, but this is what it might look like.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> ok

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> You can just safely delete the Agama.app from your /Applications.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Just delete it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> It will not delete this Komodo folder.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Then get the Verus Enhanced Agama Wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Which supports the Pirate coin.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> I guess @Oink can point out which one is best

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> Yes I have it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> start that as normal and you'll have access to your PIRTATE/VRSC/KMD and all things via Verus.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> but I think I activated ARRR there at least once, while also having the old agama on my Mac

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Once you have access to your native coins, just create a new address in this Verus Agama Wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Make sure to backup the private key/wif/privkey of that address first.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Then close the wallet, and make sure to take the backup of `wallet.dat` file from each folder you find in Komodo form the screen shot you see

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> each folder means Komdo/wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> then Komodo/PIRATE/wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> then Komodo/VRSC/wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> each Assetchain inside of that Komodo folder gets their own folder and has their own independent wallet.dat files.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> make sure to have the backup of each of them.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> save then on some external USB etc or wherever you feel safer.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Then restart the Verus Agama Wallet and send all the funds to that new address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Since you are using the Native wallets, which is THE BEST CHOICE!, you should keep a habit of keeping the backup of the wallet.dat files

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> OK

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> make that habit of always taking the backup of the wallet.dat file before you send funds from it.
And once after sending funds from it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <D2D> yes good idea

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> name that backup with the name of date/time so you have the backups consistent.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Don't delete old backjps

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> backups*

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> keep them ALL.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> To interject: If you plan to use coins in native mode: Agama 0.5.6a will be best

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Be safer and always prefer to use Native mode for your all coins as much possible.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> @D2D but in any case, if you couldn't figure out how to backup the address wif/privkey backups, just follow my advice of taking backup of wallet.dat files preiodically.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> if you rename your existing wallet.dat to something else, there won't be any existing wallet.dat.
and then when you will start a native mode coin, it will check if there is wallet.dat file or not. if not, it will create a new one for you.

Author: Gateway#3763

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> make a *copy* of your existing wallet.dat file and then use Verus Agama.
